page.title: 08Old Cotswold Farmhouses
page.content: Kineton Hill farmhouse has dates inside it from the 1600's. It is on a site of ancient occupation as recently Roman finds have come to light, including a pottery kiln. We were able to handle saggers from the kiln on which pots had been rested during firing. It appears that there was Roman activity along the whole length of the road past Kineton Hill. Swell Hill farmhouse is also very old and built on an ancient site, as it is the only building near Condicote Lane and the old drove road. Other houses in the area are of later origin, as most of the land once belonged to one large estate. Swell Buildings farm is so named because it is made out of a stone barn. The original farmhouse is now a hotel in Lower Swell.
